com.github.macgregor.alexandria

Class PathFinder.GlobFileFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.commons.io.filefilter.AbstractFileFilter
      • com.github.macgregor.alexandria.PathFinder.GlobFileFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FileFilter, FilenameFilter, org.apache.commons.io.filefilter.IOFileFilter
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PathFinder.RelativeFileFilter
    Enclosing class:
    PathFinder

    public static class PathFinder.GlobFileFilter
extends org.apache.commons.io.filefilter.AbstractFileFilter
    File filter that matches glob patterns against absolute file paths. For example, if you have a directory structure like this: 
     home
 └── project
     ├── exclude
     │   └── README.md
     └── include
         ├── README.md
         └── subdir
             └── foo.md
    where /home/project is the base directory being scanned, then /home/project/include/*.md would match /home/project/include/README.md but not /home/project/exclude/README.md or /home/project/include/subdir/foo.md. **include/** would match both .md files under the include directory, which feels a bit unnatural and could lead to inadvertent matches as directories grow. PathFinder.RelativeFileFilter adds this ability. For full details on glob syntax see FileSystem.getPathMatcher(String).
